Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: BIOL 520E Special Topics in Biology - SYNTHESISSTATS
Description: With permission of the department head, this course may be taken more than once with a different topic. Credit will be granted for only one of BIOL 520 or BIOL 420 when the subject matter is of the same nature.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: BIOL 520F Special Topics in Biology - SCIENTIFICCOLLAB
Description: With permission of the department head, this course may be taken more than once with a different topic. Credit will be granted for only one of BIOL 520 or BIOL 420 when the subject matter is of the same nature.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: BIOL 520I Special Topics in Biology - ECOLOGYEVOLUTION
Description: With permission of the department head, this course may be taken more than once with a different topic. Credit will be granted for only one of BIOL 520 or BIOL 420 when the subject matter is of the same nature.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: BIOL 552C Directed Studies in Biology - CONSERV GENOMICS
Description: Allows investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the supervisory committee and the student. This course may be taken more than once with a different topic. No more than 6 credits may be completed with the same instructor.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Permission of the graduate program advisor and the course instructor.)

Name: BIOL 552S Directed Studies in Biology - ECOL RESTOR ARID
Description: Allows investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the supervisory committee and the student. This course may be taken more than once with a different topic. No more than 6 credits may be completed with the same instructor.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Permission of the graduate program advisor and the course instructor.)

Name: BIOL 552U Directed Studies in Biology - PLNT MICROBE INT
Description: Allows investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the supervisory committee and the student. This course may be taken more than once with a different topic. No more than 6 credits may be completed with the same instructor.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Permission of the graduate program advisor and the course instructor.)

Name: BIOL 552V Directed Studies in Biology - HEALTH NUTRITION
Description: Allows investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the supervisory committee and the student. This course may be taken more than once with a different topic. No more than 6 credits may be completed with the same instructor.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: BIOL 552W Directed Studies in Biology - NUTRITION EDUC
Description: Allows investigation on a specific topic as agreed upon by the supervisory committee and the student. This course may be taken more than once with a different topic. No more than 6 credits may be completed with the same instructor.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Permission of the graduate program advisor and the course instructor.)

Name: BIOL 599 M.Sc. Thesis
Description: Pass/Fail.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: BIOL 699 Ph.D. Thesis
Description: Pass/Fail.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: CCS 150 Creative and Critical Art Theory I
Description: Introduction to Western, Indigenous, and global art practices and theoretical discourses through the discussion and examination of forms, context, and ideas that contribute to cultural and contemporary art practices.

Name: CCS 250 Creative and Critical Art Theory II
Description: The continued study of Western, Indigenous, and global art practices and the theoretical discourses that contribute to the development of contemporary art.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CCS 150.

Name: CCS 506 M.F.A. Graduate Colloquium I
Description: Multi-disciplinary seminar dealing with various approaches and issues in contemporary creative research methods as relating to the disciplines of Visual Arts, Media Arts, Creative Writing, and Performance. Restricted to students in the M.F.A. program.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Restricted to students in the MFA program or permission of the Department of Creative Studies.)

Name: CCS 507 M.F.A. Graduate Colloquium II
Description: Multi-disciplinary seminar dealing with various approaches and issues in contemporary creative research methods as relating to the disciplines of Visual Arts, Media Arts, Creative Writing, and Performance. Students will be expected to develop creative work and a thesis plan.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CCS 506. (or permission of the Department of Creative Studies.)

Name: CCS 599 Master's Thesis
Description: Pass/Fail.

Name: CHEM 121 Atomic and Molecular Chemistry
Description: Stoichiometry, atomic and molecular structure, chemical periodicity, gases, liquids, solids, and solutions. Required course for all students needing a first-year Chemistry course who have Chemistry 12. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 121 or CHEM 111.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 12 and one of MATH 12, PREC 12.

Name: CHEM 123 Physical and Organic Chemistry
Description: Principles of equilibrium and chemical thermodynamics. Introductory organic chemistry: stereochemistry; substitution, elimination, and oxidation-reduction reactions. This course or CHEM 113 is prerequisite to all subsequent courses in Chemistry. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 123 or CHEM 113.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 121.

Name: CHEM 201 Introduction to Physical Chemistry
Description: Principles of chemical kinetics, reaction mechanisms, and chemical thermodynamics. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 201 or 210.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of MATH 101, MATH 103 and one of PHYS 121, PHYS 122 and one of CHEM 113, CHEM 123. (A minimum grade of 65% in CHEM 113 is strongly recommended. MATH 200 is also strongly recommended.)

Name: CHEM 203 Introduction to Organic Chemistry
Description: Structure, bonding, and physical properties of aliphatic and aromatic compounds; conformational analysis, stereochemistry, and NMR spectroscopy; substitution and elimination reactions of alkyl halides; ethers, epoxides, aldehydes, ketones. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 203 or CHEM 213.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students with one of these specializations: MAJ BIOC,MAJ CHEM,MAJ ENCH
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 113, CHEM 123. (A minimum grade of 65% in CHEM 113 is strongly recommended. For Chemistry, Biochemistry, and Environmental Chemistry majors. Other students should enrol in CHEM 213.)

Name: CHEM 204 Organic Chemistry
Description: Mechanistic analysis of chemical reactivity of common functional groups, with focus on carbonyl chemistry; aromaticity and aromatic substitution; functional group transformations in organic synthesis; carbohydrates, amino acids, proteins, heterocycles. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 204 or CHEM 214.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students with one of these specializations: MAJ CHEM,MAJ BIOC,MAJ ENCH
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 203. (For Chemistry, Biochemistry, and Environmental Chemistry majors. Other students should enrol in CHEM 214.)

Name: CHEM 211 Analytical Chemistry
Description: Methods of measurement, statistical analysis and errors of measurement, method development and validation, the meaning of test results, accuracy, precision, biosensors, analytical electrochemistry, chemical separation, introduction to gas and liquid chromatography. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 211 or BIOC 211.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 113, CHEM 123 and one of PHYS 121, PHYS 122.

Name: CHEM 213 Organic Chemistry for Biological Sciences I
Description: Structure, bonding, and physical properties of organic compounds; conformational analysis, stereochemistry, and chirality; reactions of alkenes, alkyl halides, and alcohols. Emphasis will be placed on biological applications. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 203 or CHEM 213.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 113, CHEM 123. (Not for Chemistry, Biochemistry, or Environmental Chemistry majors. Such students should enrol in CHEM 203.)

Name: CHEM 214 Organic Chemistry for Biological Sciences II
Description: Mechanistic description of aromatic substitution, reactions of carbonyl compounds and amines, oxidation/reduction reactions. Chemistry of carbohydrates, amino acids, vitamins, lipids, nucleotides. Chemical principles of biological catalysis and metabolism. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 204 or CHEM 214.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 203, CHEM 213. (Not for Chemistry, Biochemistry, or Environmental Chemistry majors. Such students should enrol in CHEM 204.)

Name: CHEM 220 Atomic Structure and Molecular Bonding
Description: Examination of various theories of atomic structure and molecular bonding, and their use to explain chemical and physical properties of atoms and molecules. Atomic wave mechanics, Lewis theory, valence bond theory, crystal field theory, symmetry and group theory, and molecular orbital theory of diatomic and polyatomic molecules and extended solids.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 113, CHEM 123. (A minimum grade of 65% in CHEM 113 is strongly recommended.)

Name: CHEM 301 Aqueous Environmental Chemistry
Description: Properties of natural waters, including gas and solid equilibria, pH, redox, complexation analysis, corrosion treatment, ion exchange, colloids, and microbial transformations.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of MATH 101, MATH 103 and one of CHEM 201, CHEM 210.

Name: CHEM 302 Atmospheric Environmental Chemistry
Description: Introduction to structure, composition, and chemical processes occurring in Earth's atmosphere including interactions with solar radiation, stratospheric ozone layer, photochemical smog, and acid rain.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of MATH 101, MATH 103 and one of CHEM 113, CHEM 123 and one of PHYS 121, PHYS 122. (One of CHEM 210, 211 is recommended.)

Name: CHEM 304 Advanced Physical Chemistry
Description: Review of thermodynamics concepts; solution thermodynamics; electrochemistry; chemical equilibria, phase equilibria, colloid science. Emphasis on applications of thermodynamics to both chemical and biochemical systems.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 201. (MATH 200 is recommended.)

Name: CHEM 305 Biophysical Chemistry
Description: Diffusion and transport phenomena of biomolecules. Interaction of radiation and matter in biochemical systems. Methods to determine molar mass, size, and shape of biomolecules in solution. MATH 200 is strongly recommended.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 201, CHEM 210.

Name: CHEM 311 Instrumental Analytical Chemistry
Description: Overview of instrumental methods of chemical analysis, including spectroscopic methods, mass spectrometry, electrophoresis and chromatography.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 211. (One of BIOL 202, STAT 230 is strongly recommended.)

Name: CHEM 312 Introduction to Quantum Mechanics and Spectroscopy
Description: Principles of quantum mechanics, atomic wavefunctions, angular momentum, spin, atomic term symbols.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 201.

Name: CHEM 317 Environmental Physical Organic Chemistry
Description: Basic physiochemical processes governing the fate, transport, distribution, properties, and reactions of anthropogenic organic compounds in the environment including pesticides and herbicides. Includes aspects of the photochemistry, structure-activity relationships, detection, toxicology, remediation, and social impact of such compounds.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of MATH 101, MATH 103 and one of CHEM 204, CHEM 214 and one of PHYS 121, PHYS 122.

Name: CHEM 319 Topics in Computerized Instrumentation
Description: Computerized data acquisition and analysis in chemistry instrumentation, development of new instruments to collect and analyze experimental data: Digital acquisition systems, optical systems, electrical circuits, and coding.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of CHEM 201, MATH 200.

Name: CHEM 330 Advanced Organic Chemistry
Description: Application of carbonyl group chemistry, cyclisation reactions, conformational analysis, and rearrangement reactions in organic synthesis.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 204, CHEM 214.

Name: CHEM 333 Spectroscopic Techniques in Organic Chemistry
Description: Application of mass spectrometry, NMR, and IR spectroscopies to organic chemical problems.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 204, CHEM 214.

Name: CHEM 335 Bioinorganic Chemistry
Description: Examination of the involvement of inorganic chemistry in biological systems; structure and chemistry of metalloproteins and metalloenzymes. Nature of proteins, biomolecules, and simple bonding models of d-block compounds; iron and copper proteins involved with electron and oxygen transport and oxygen and nitrogen activation, various proteins of zinc and nickel.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CHEM 204, CHEM 214 and one of CHEM 201, CHEM 210.

Name: CHEM 336 Green Inorganic Chemistry
Description: Use of inorganic and organometallic catalysts for sustainable synthesis. Renewable feedstock conversion, selective carbon-hydrogen bond functionalization, biodegradable polymer synthesis, photoredox catalysis, solar fuels.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 220 and one of CHEM 204, CHEM 214.

Name: CHEM 338 Organometallic Chemistry
Description: Examination of the structure, bonding, reactivity, and catalysis of organometallic compounds of the d-block metals. A survey of ligands unique to organometallic chemistry is followed by an examination of the mechanisms of common reactions and important catalytic cycles.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 220 and one of CHEM 204, CHEM 214.

Name: CHEM 403 Enzymology
Description: Enzyme kinetics: steady-state kinetic analyses, fast-reaction methods, kinetic isotope effects. Catalytic mechanisms: coenzymology, radical-mediated reactions, catalytic rate enhancements. Special topics: enzyme evolution, multifunctional enzymes, biocatalysis, protein engineering. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 403, BIOC 403, CHEM 413 or CHEM 569.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of BIOC 304, BIOL 311.

Name: CHEM 412 Methods in Metabolomics
Description: Chemical analysis of the metabolites in biological samples: study design, sample extractions, method development and validation, targeted and untargeted experiments, data processing, isotope tracer studies, chemoinformatics, compound identification, metabolic pathway and network mapping, data interpretation and presentation. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 412, BIOC 412 or CHEM 533.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: BSC-O in year: >=4 with one of these specializations: ****CHEM,****BIOC,****ENCH
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 211. (and fourth-year standing in Chemistry or Environmental Chemistry.)

Name: CHEM 422A Special Topics in Chemistry - NATURAL PROD
Description: An advanced or specialized topic in chemistry, generally with an emphasis on recent literature. Topics will usually vary with each course offering. With different topics, the course can be taken more than once for credit. Each offering will normally be 3 credits.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: BSC-O in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (To be determined by special topic; third-year standing in Science; and permission of the department head.)

Name: CHEM 422E Special Topics in Chemistry - MOL BIOPHYS
Description: An advanced or specialized topic in chemistry, generally with an emphasis on recent literature. Topics will usually vary with each course offering. With different topics, the course can be taken more than once for credit. Each offering will normally be 3 credits.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: BSC-O in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (To be determined by special topic; third-year standing in Science; and permission of the department head.)

Name: CHEM 422V Special Topics in Chemistry - CHEMICAL BIOLOGY
Description: An advanced or specialized topic in chemistry, generally with an emphasis on recent literature. Topics will usually vary with each course offering. With different topics, the course can be taken more than once for credit. Each offering will normally be 3 credits.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: BSC-O in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (To be determined by special topic; third-year standing in Science; and permission of the department head.)

Name: CHEM 429 Main Group Chemistry
Description: Principles, patterns, and trends of the characteristic structures, bonding, and reactivity of compounds of the s- and p-block elements, including aspects relevant to polymer chemistry, materials chemistry, industrial chemistry, and advanced main group synthesis.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 220 and one of CHEM 204, CHEM 214.

Name: CHEM 434 Chromatography and Mass Spectrometry
Description: Gas, liquid, and supercritical fluid chromatography. Mass spectrometry: ionization processes, mass analyses, ion molecule reactions, fragmentation processes. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 434 or CHEM 411.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 311.

Name: CHEM 448A Directed Studies in Chemistry - DST CHEMISTRY
Description: Original research under the direction of a faculty member for either one (3 credits) or two (6 credits) semesters. Includes a written thesis and poster presentation. It is recommended that CHEM 448 not be taken until a student's final year of study.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=4 with one of these specializations: MAJ CHEM,MAJ ENCH
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Fourth year standing in the Chemistry or Environmental Chemistry Major with a minimum overall grade average of 72%, and approval of both the Chemistry Curriculum Committee and a faculty supervisor.)

Name: CHEM 448B Directed Studies in Chemistry - DST CHEMISTRY
Description: Original research under the direction of a faculty member for either one (3 credits) or two (6 credits) semesters. Includes a written thesis and poster presentation. It is recommended that CHEM 448 not be taken until a student's final year of study.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=4 with one of these specializations: MAJ CHEM,MAJ ENCH
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Fourth year standing in the Chemistry or Environmental Chemistry Major with a minimum overall grade average of 72%, and approval of both the Chemistry Curriculum Committee and a faculty supervisor.)

Name: CHEM 448C Directed Studies in Chemistry - DST CHEMISTRY
Description: Original research under the direction of a faculty member for either one (3 credits) or two (6 credits) semesters. Includes a written thesis and poster presentation. It is recommended that CHEM 448 not be taken until a student's final year of study.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=4 with one of these specializations: MAJ CHEM,MAJ ENCH
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Fourth year standing in the Chemistry or Environmental Chemistry Major with a minimum overall grade average of 72%, and approval of both the Chemistry Curriculum Committee and a faculty supervisor.)

Name: CHEM 449 Honours Thesis
Description: Original research work under the direction of a faculty member. A written thesis, public poster presentation, and public thesis defence is required. It is recommended that CHEM 449 not be taken until a student's final year of study.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=4 with one of these specializations: MAJ CHEM,MAJ ENCH
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Fourth-year standing in the Chemistry or Environmental Chemistry Major with a minimum overall grade average of 76% (in all courses taken applicable to the Chemistry Major) and approval of the Chemistry Curriculum Committee.)

Name: CHEM 461 Advanced Analytical Chemistry Laboratory
Description: Integrated laboratory course designed to illustrate principles of modern analytical chemistry.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 311.

Name: CHEM 462 Advanced Inorganic Chemistry Laboratory
Description: Integrated laboratory course designed to illustrate principles of modern inorganic chemistry.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Two of CHEM 335, CHEM 336, CHEM 337, CHEM 338.

Name: CHEM 463 Advanced Organic Chemistry Laboratory
Description: Integrated laboratory course designed to illustrate principles of modern organic chemistry.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CHEM 330 and one of CHEM 317, CHEM 333, CHEM 413.

Name: CHEM 464 Advanced Physical and Biophysical Chemistry Laboratory
Description: Integrated laboratory course designed to illustrate principles of modern physical and biophysical chemistry.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Two of CHEM 304, CHEM 305, CHEM 312.

Name: CHEM 507B Topics in Physical Chemistry - COMPTTNL CHEM
Description: Seminar presentation required based on current literature in the field. With different topics, the course can be taken more than once for credit. Each offering will normally be 3 credits. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 507 or CHEM 422 when the subject matter is of the same nature.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: CHEM 533 Metabolomics
Description: Chemical analysis of the metabolites in biological samples. Targeted and untargeted metabolomics, chemometrics, metabolite identification, pathway and network mapping, data interpretation and presentation. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 533, CHEM 412 or BIOC 412.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: CHEM 540 Graduate Seminar in Chemistry
Description: Students present a one-hour lecture on a topic agreed upon jointly with the instructor, but unrelated to their previous or current research projects. Students will be assessed on their seminar and a related written paper.

Name: CHEM 569 Advanced Mechanistic Enzymology
Description: The chemistry of enzyme active sites, cofactors, and inhibitors. Enzyme kinetics, thermodynamics, kinetic isotope effects, and other physical methods. Credit will be granted for only one of CHEM 569, CHEM 403, CHEM 413 or BIOC 403.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MASC-O,MED-O,MENG-O,MFA-O,MM-O,MSC-O,MSN-O,MSW-O,PHD-O

Name: CHEM 649 Ph.D. Thesis

Name: CHIN 100 Basic Chinese I
Description: An introduction to the grammar, syntax, and function of modern spoken and written Mandarin Chinese. For absolute beginners; not available to students who have obtained the equivalent of CEFR Level A1 in any Chinese language.

Name: CHIN 101 Basic Chinese II
Description: Continuation of CHIN 100. Not available to students who have obtained the equivalent of CEFR Level A1 in any Chinese language.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: A score of 55% or higher in CHIN 100.

Name: COOP 401 Co-op Education Work Experience I
Description: Approved and supervised paid work experience with a public or private organization for a minimum of 455 hours full time. Pre-employment training workshops and co-op assignments are required. Course is restricted to students who have completed all third-year requirements and have secured a work-term with an appropriate employer either independently or through the 'Co-op Office'.

Name: COOP 402 Co-op Education Work Experience II
Description: Approved and supervised paid work experience with a public or private organization for a minimum of 455 hours full time. Pre-employment training workshops and co-op assignments are required. Course is restricted to students who have completed all third-year requirements and have secured a work-term with an appropriate employer either independently or through the 'Co-op Office'.

Name: CORH 203 Communication in the Sciences
Description: Practice-based course that develops intermediate level communication skills in the sciences. Emphasis on analysis of scientific literature and communicating science to experts in the discipline and lay audiences, in written, visual, oral, and digital modes.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of ENGL 109, ENGL 112, ENGL 114, ENGL 150, ENGL 151, ENGL 153, ENGL 155, ENGL 156, APSC 176.

Name: CORH 204 Communications in the Humanities
Description: Practice-based course that develops intermediate level communication skills in the humanities. Emphasis on analysis of humanities literature and communicating the humanities to experts in the discipline and lay audiences, in written, visual, oral, and digital modes.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of ENGL 109, ENGL 112, ENGL 114, ENGL 150, ENGL 151, ENGL 153, ENGL 154, ENGL 155, ENGL 156, APSC 176.

Name: CORH 205 Communication in the Social Sciences
Description: Practice-based course that develops intermediate level communication in the social sciences. Emphasis on analysis of social science literature and communicating the social sciences to experts in the discipline and lay audiences, in written, visual, oral, and digital modes.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of ENGL 109, ENGL 112, ENGL 114, ENGL 150, ENGL 151, ENGL 153, ENGL 154, ENGL 155, ENGL 156, APSC 176.

Name: CORH 216 Communication and Media
Description: Theory and practice of communication about, in and for various media, including digital, textual, audio and/or visual forms.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of ENGL 109, ENGL 112, ENGL 114, ENGL 150, ENGL 151, ENGL 153, ENGL 154, ENGL 155, ENGL 156, APSC 176.

Name: CORH 304 Persuasive Rhetoric, Public Speaking, and Advocacy
Description: Advanced public speaking, persuasive rhetoric, and advocacy to generate social and community change. Recommended prerequisite: THTR 104.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing or permission of the instructor.)

Name: CORH 321 Personal and Professional Identity and Interpersonal Communication
Description: Multidisciplinary concepts of and approaches to identity and agency in personal and professional interpersonal communication settings, face-to-face and online. Fosters application of communication skills and enactments of agency in dyadic and collaborative contexts.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing or permission of the instructor.)

Name: CORH 331 Social Writing: Studies in Multimodal Communication
Description: Practice-based approach to social media through writing studies' scholarship, with a focus on rhetorical analysis of social writing in digital platforms that inform self-representation and connect with groups/communities.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing or permission of the instructor.)

Name: CORH 499 Communication Capstone
Description: Team-conducted project that identifies and addresses a professional, community, or academic topic, demonstrating an awareness of audience and context. Integrates knowledge and skills acquired throughout the certificate program.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (9 credits of CORH certificate courses and third-year standing.)

Name: COSC 101 Digital Citizenship
Description: Knowledge and skills to navigate the digital society. Digital participation, digital access, skills and utilization. Digital literacy, computer applications, converging technologies, and online resources. This course does not assume students have any Computer Science background.

Name: COSC 111 Computer Programming I
Description: Introduction to the design, implementation, and understanding of computer programs. Topics include problem solving, algorithm design, and data and procedural abstraction, with emphasis on the development of working programs. This course should be followed by COSC 121.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: A score of 70% or higher in one of PREC 12, MATH 12, MATH 125, MATH 126.

Name: COSC 121 Computer Programming II
Description: Advanced programming in the application of software engineering techniques to the design and implementation of programs manipulating complex data structures.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: A score of 60% or higher in one of COSC 111, COSC 123.

Name: COSC 122 Computer Fluency
Description: Introduction to computer skills (electronic communication, websites, Internet, document editing, programming, data analysis using spreadsheets/databases) and concepts (information representation, abstraction, algorithmic thinking). Course objectives are lifelong productivity and understanding of technology in society.

Name: COSC 123 Computer Creativity
Description: A hands-on introduction to programming and computer-based problem solving and creativity. Experience with application development including storytelling, graphics, games, and networking.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of COSC 111, COSC 122.

Name: COSC 210 Software Construction
Description: Design, and implementation of software components. Data structures, object-oriented design, debugging, testing. Credits will only be granted for one of COSC 210 or COSC 222.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of APSC 177, COSC 111.

Name: COSC 211 Machine Architecture
Description: Organization and design of computer systems and their impact on the practice of software development. Instruction set architecture and assembly programming languages, design of central processing units (CPU), memory hierarchy and cache organization, input and output programming.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: COSC 121.

Name: COSC 221 Introduction to Discrete Structures
Description: Sets, logic, combinatorics, and graph theory, as applied in computing: sets and propositions, permutations and combinations, graphs and trees, Boolean algebra, algorithms, and applications.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 142, APSC 173.

Name: COSC 222 Data Structures
Description: Introduction to the design, implementation and analysis of data structures. Topics will include lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. Credit will only be granted for one of COSC 210 or COSC 222.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: A score of 60% or higher in COSC 121.

Name: COSC 301 Introduction to Data Analytics
Description: Software development and techniques for computation, analysis, and visualization of data. Manipulation of small and large data sets. Automation using scripting. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 301, DATA 301 or DATA 501.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: COSC 303 Numerical Analysis
Description: Numerical techniques for basic mathematical processes and their analysis. Taylor polynomials, root-finding, linear systems, eigenvalues, approximating derivatives, locating minimizers, approximating integrals, solving differential equations. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 303 or MATH 303.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of MATH 200, MATH 221 and either (a) COSC 111 or (b) DATA 301.

Name: COSC 304 Introduction to Databases
Description: Databases from a user's perspective: querying with SQL, designing with UML, and using programs to analyze data. Construction of database-driven applications and websites and experience with current database technologies. Completion of COSC 121 is recommended.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of COSC 111, COSC 123, COSC 210. (Third-year standing.)

Name: COSC 305 Project Management
Description: Examine tools and techniques to complete projects successfully, and within budget. Topics include Program Evaluation and Review Technique (PERT) and Critical Path Methods (CPM), and project management software.

Name: COSC 310 Software Engineering
Description: Techniques to construct large systems using fundamental activities of specification, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance. Various life cycle models, exposure to software development tools, modelling techniques, good development practices, and project management.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of COSC 210, COSC 222, COSC 223. (and third-year standing.)

Name: COSC 320 Analysis of Algorithms
Description: Design and analysis of algorithms, illustrated from various problem areas. Models of computation, choice of data structures, space and time efficiency, computation complexity, algorithms for searching, sorting and graph-theoretic problems, NP-complete problems.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of COSC 221, COSC 222 and one of MATH 221, APSC 179.

Name: COSC 322 Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
Description: AI and intelligent agents; state space search; game playing agents; logic and knowledge-based agents; constraint programming; planning; reasoning and decision making under uncertainty; machine learning; natural language understanding. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 322 or COSC 522.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of COSC 221, COSC 222.

Name: COSC 328 Introduction to Networks
Description: The five-layer Internet architecture using TCP/IP: application, transport, network, link, and physical. Topics include web protocols, network programming, routing, addressing, congestion control, error handling, Ethernet, wireless networks, security, multimedia transmission, and network management.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of COSC 211, COSC 222.

Name: COSC 329 Learning Analytics
Description: Introduction to data analytics and machine learning techniques in the context of educational data. Focuses on user profiling, collaborative filtering, clustering, Bayesian user modeling, preference elicitation, and plagiarism detection. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 329, COSC 419C, or COSC 519C.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: COSC 222 and one of STAT 121, STAT 230.

Name: COSC 335 Introduction to Medical Imaging and Imaging Informatics
Description: Fundamental image analysis techniques. Image creation, manipulation, optimization, and analysis to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of human health conditions. Generation and display of X-ray, CT, MRI, Ultrasound and Nuclear Medicine images. Imaging Informatics and its place in the Electronic Medical Record. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 335 or PHYS 336.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: A score more than 60% in COSC 222 and a score more than 60% in one of PHYS 121, PHYS 122. (PHYS 121 preferred.)

Name: COSC 341 Human Computer Interaction
Description: History of human-computer interaction. Basic design principles, user-centered design, user task analysis, interaction models, input and output devices, graphical interface design, prototyping, and evaluation.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of COSC 111, COSC 121, COSC 123, DATA 301. (and Third-year standing.)

Name: COSC 344 Image Processing and Applications
Description: Fundamental theoretical and practical concepts for processing and analyzing real-world digital images and videos, image enhancement and filtering, frequency domain and other transform analysis, morphological image operations, image segmentation, and object recognition. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 344, COSC 435, or COSC 445.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of COSC 210, COSC 222 and one of MATH 200, APSC 248 and one of MATH 221, APSC 179.

Name: COSC 360 Web Programming
Description: Design and implementation of web-based information systems and app development. Rich user interfaces, asynchronous updates, client-side and server-side scripting using standard technologies such as HTML, CSS, SVG, JavaScript, PHP. Data manipulation with SQL, JSON, XML. Modern scripting frameworks and libraries.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of COSC 121, COSC 304. (and third-year standing.)

Name: COSC 407 Introduction to Parallel Computing
Description: Design and implementation of parallel programs including theoretical computer models, parallel architectures (distributed, multicore, GPU), and standard parallel libraries. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 407 or COSC 507.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Either (a) COSC 111 or (b) APSC 177. (Third-year standing is required.)

Name: COSC 414 Computer Graphics
Description: Human vision and colour, modelling, geometric transformations, algorithms for 2-D and 3-D graphics, hardware and system architectures, shading and lighting, animation.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of COSC 221, COSC 222 and one of MATH 221, APSC 179.

Name: COSC 421 Network Science
Description: Graphs and complex networks in scientific research. Probabilistic and statistical models. Structures, patterns, and behaviors in networks. Algorithmic and statistical methods (online/mobile), social networks, and social media platforms. Social influence, information diffusion, and viral marketing. Sentiment analysis and opinion mining. Data privacy. Search engines and recommendation systems. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 421, COSC 521, DATA 421 or DATA 521.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: STAT 230.

Name: COSC 444 Computer Vision
Description: Advanced vision methods that enable machines to analyze and understand images. Fundamental problems in computer vision and the state-of-the-art approaches that address them. Feature detection and matching, geometric and multi-view vision, structure from X, segmentation, object tracking and visual recognition, and deep learning methods. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 444, COSC 544 or COSC 545.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: COSC 344.

Name: COSC 447 Directed Studies in Software Maintenance
Description: Maintenance of a large software system including prioritizing requests, modifying the design, implementing new features, fixing bugs, and regression testing. The student will undertake the maintenance of an existing project.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing and permission of the department head.)

Name: COSC 448A Directed Studies in Computer Science - DIR STDY COMP SC
Description: Supervised reading, participation in a seminar, and one or more programming projects. With different topics, this course may be taken twice for credit.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing and permission of the department head.)

Name: COSC 448B Directed Studies in Computer Science - DIR STDY COMP SC
Description: Supervised reading, participation in a seminar, and one or more programming projects. With different topics, this course may be taken twice for credit.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing and permission of the department head.)

Name: COSC 448C Directed Studies in Computer Science - DIR STDY COMP SC
Description: Supervised reading, participation in a seminar, and one or more programming projects. With different topics, this course may be taken twice for credit.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing and permission of the department head.)

Name: COSC 449 Honours Thesis
Description: Students will undertake a research project as agreed upon by the student, supervising faculty member, and department head. A written thesis and a public presentation (poster or seminar) are required.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=4 with one of these specializations: HON COSC
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Fourth-year standing; admission to the B.A. or B.Sc. Computer Science Honours Program; and permission of the department head.)

Name: COSC 499 Capstone Software Engineering Project
Description: A capstone project requiring team software development for an actual client. Students must produce a comprehensive report and deliver a formal presentation.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of COSC 304, COSC 310, COSC 341.

Name: COSC 507 Parallel Computing
Description: Design, implementation and performance analysis of parallel programs. Theoretical computer models, parallel architectures, and standard parallel libraries. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 407 or COSC 507.

Name: COSC 519A Topics in Computer Science - ADV INT DESIGN
Description: Specialized topics in computer science. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 419 or COSC 519 when the subject matter is of the same nature.

Name: COSC 519I Topics in Computer Science - COMP GRAPHICS
Description: Specialized topics in computer science. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 419 or COSC 519 when the subject matter is of the same nature.

Name: COSC 519J Topics in Computer Science - IMMERSIVE TECH
Description: Specialized topics in computer science. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 419 or COSC 519 when the subject matter is of the same nature.

Name: COSC 520 Advanced Algorithms
Description: Algorithm design, analysis and application. Algorithmic graph theory, parameterization, approximation, and randomization techniques. Algorithms for computational-hard problems and problems involving large-scale networks and/or massive datasets. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 320 or COSC 520.

Name: COSC 521 Network Science
Description: Graphs and complex networks in scientific research. Probabilistic and statistical models. Structures, patterns, and behaviors in networks. Algorithmic and statistical methods. (online/mobile) social networks and social media platforms. Social influence, information diffusion, and viral marketing. Sentiment analysis and opinion mining. Data privacy. Search engines and recommendation systems. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 421, COSC 521, DATA 421 or DATA 521.

Name: COSC 544 Computer Vision
Description: Computer vision methods and problem-solving techniques. Feature detection and matching, geometric and multi-view vision, structure from X, segmentation, object tracking and visual recognition, and deep learning methods. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 444, COSC 544 or COSC 545.

Name: COSC 548 Directed Studies
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3

Name: COSC 549 Master's Thesis
Description: Pass/Fail.

Name: COSC 550 Master's Project
Description: Pass/Fail.

Name: COSC 590A Graduate Seminar - GRAD SEMINAR
Description: Presentation and discussion of recent results in the Computer Science literature. Pass/Fail.

Name: COSC 590B Graduate Seminar - GRAD SEMINAR
Description: Presentation and discussion of recent results in the Computer Science literature. Pass/Fail.

Name: COSC 649 Doctoral Dissertation
Description: Pass/Fail.

Name: COSC 690 Research Skills
Description: Completion of a small research project that generates original results. Written and oral presentation required. Pass/Fail.

Name: CRWR 150 Introduction to Writing Poetry and Non-Fiction
Description: Introduction to composition and experimentation in the genres of poetry and creative non-fiction. Students will develop a working knowledge of modern aesthetics in poetry and creative nonfiction, as well as an objective appreciation of their own "voice" in the context of those aesthetics. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CRWR 150, CRWR 160.

Name: CRWR 160 Introduction to Writing Fiction and Drama
Description: Introduction to composition and experimentation in the genres of fiction and drama. Students will develop a working knowledge of modern aesthetics in fiction and drama, as well as an objective appreciation of their own "voice" in the context of those aesthetics. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CRWR 150, CRWR 160.

Name: CRWR 205 Writing Popular Fiction
Description: Introduction to writing genre fiction, such as fantasy, science fiction, horror, vampire, zombie, mystery, thriller, young adult and other genre fiction. Genres will change annually.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (6 credits first-year English)

Name: CRWR 216 Intermediate Workshop in Creative Writing: Poetry
Description: Intermediate creative writing course. Students are instructed and guided in the writing of poetry, are encouraged to pursue experimentation in poetry, and will participate in the feedback and critique sessions that constitute the workshop method.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CRWR 150.

Name: CRWR 217 Intermediate Workshop in Creative Writing: Fiction
Description: Intermediate creative writing course. Students are instructed and guided in the writing of fiction, are encouraged to pursue experimentation in fiction, and will participate in the feedback and critique sessions that constitute the workshop method.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: CRWR 160.

Name: CRWR 218 Intermediate Workshop in Creative Writing: Playwriting
Description: Intermediate creative writing course. Students are instructed and guided in the writing of plays, are encouraged to pursue experimentation in drama, and will participate in the feedback and critique sessions that constitute the workshop method.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CRWR 160, THTR 103.

Name: CRWR 250 Workshop in Creative Writing: Screenwriting
Description: Students are instructed and guided in the writing of screenplays, are encouraged to pursue experimentation in screenwriting, and will participate in the feedback and critique sessions that constitute the workshop method. Credit will be granted for only one of CRWR 250 or FILM 250.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of CRWR 150, CRWR 160, VISA 104, VISA 105, VISA 106, VISA 108, THTR 101, THTR 102.

Name: CRWR 260 Theory and Practice of Creative Writing
Description: Recommended for students taking Creative Writing, English, Visual Arts, or Performance courses. Introduces students to the history of contemporary forms of creative writing. Students will write on problems of aesthetics and practice various forms.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Two of ENGL 112, ENGL 113, ENGL 150, ENGL 151, ENGL 153, CRWR 150, CRWR 160.

Name: CRWR 380 Writing of the Short Story
Description: Advanced workshop in the writing of short fiction. Restricted to students with at least third-year standing. Restricted to Creative Writing Majors and Minors except with permission of the department.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3 with one of these specializations: MAJ CRWR,MIN CRWR
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Either (a) two of CRWR 205, CRWR 216, CRWR 217, CRWR 218, CRWR 219, CRWR 250, CRWR 260 or (b) two of CRWR 210, CRWR 216, CRWR 217, CRWR 218, CRWR 219, CRWR 250, CRWR 260. (For non-majors and non-minors portfolio submission is also required.)

Name: CRWR 385 Writing for Children
Description: Advanced workshop in writing for children and young adults. Restricted to students with at least third-year standing. Restricted to Creative Writing Majors and Minors except with permission of the department. Credit will be granted for only one of CRWR 385 and CRWR 382 when the subject matter is of the same nature.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Either (a) two of CRWR 205, CRWR 216, CRWR 217, CRWR 218, CRWR 219, CRWR 250, CRWR 260 or (b) two of CRWR 210, CRWR 216, CRWR 217, CRWR 218, CRWR 219, CRWR 250, CRWR 260. (For non-majors and non-minors portfolio submission is also required.)

Name: CRWR 386 Poetic Forms and Genres
Description: A practice-based exploration of traditional and contemporary poetic forms and genres in English. For non-majors and non-minors portfolio submission is also required.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Either (a) two of CRWR 205, CRWR 216, CRWR 217, CRWR 218, CRWR 219, CRWR 250, CRWR 260 or (b) two of CRWR 210, CRWR 216, CRWR 217, CRWR 218, CRWR 219, CRWR 250, CRWR 260. (For non-majors and non-minors portfolio submission is also required.)

Name: CRWR 470B Portfolio - PORTFOLIO
Description: Intensive manuscript production in one or two major genres: fiction, poetry, drama, or creative non-fiction. As students begin to shape their portfolios, they will be asked to place their work in a contemporary aesthetic context.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (6 credits from CRWR 380, CRWR 381, CRWR 382, or CRWR 471 with a minimum grade of 72% in each of these two courses. For non-majors and non-minors: portfolio submission also required.)

Name: CRWR 471 Writing of the Novel
Description: Advanced workshop in the writing of the novel or novella. Restricted to students with at least third-year standing. Restricted to Creative Writing Majors and Minors except with permission of the department.
Restrictions:
This course is restricted to students in year: >=3 -OR-
in year: >=3 with one of these specializations: MAJ CRWR,MIN CRWR
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (6 credits of Creative Writing, with 3 credits from CRWR 217, CRWR 218, CRWR 250, or CRWR 380. For non-majors and non-minors: portfolio submission is also required.)

Name: CRWR 472 Editing and Publishing
Description: For Creative Writing majors. Develops specialized skills in editing and publishing for success in professional practice. Coursework includes experiential learning with solo and group projects.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: CRWR 473 Writing and Community Learning
Description: Applied community learning aspects of creative writing. Develops specialized skills for success in professional practice by working in interdisciplinary and collaborative teams with community partners. Field trips will be required.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: CRWR 475 Preparing for a Career as a Writer
Description: Developing professional skills such as sustainable writing practices, preparing work for submission, marketing and promotion. Careers that are within and adjacent to creative writing will also be discussed. Restricted to CRWR Majors except with permission from instructor.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students with one of these specializations: ****CRWR

Name: CRWR 581C Graduate Workshop in Creative Writing - Lyric - CREAT WRIT LYRIC
Description: Manuscript production course for in-depth discussion and workshopping of lyric forms. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CRWR 581, CRWR 580, or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Admission into the MFA CRWR program, or submission of a portfolio and permission of the Department of Creative Studies.)

Name: CRWR 582C Graduate Workshop in Creative Writing- Narrative - CREAT WRIT NARR
Description: Manuscript production course for in-depth discussion and workshopping of narrative forms. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CRWR 582, CRWR 580, or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Admission into the MFA CRWR program, or submission of a portfolio and permission of the Department of Creative Studies)

Name: CULT 100 Media and Popular Cultures in Global Context
Description: Introduction to media and cultural studies in a global context, specifically the critical analysis of cultural texts, cultural industries, and media audiences.

Name: CULT 101 Cultural Studies Practices
Description: Key concepts and methods across the history of cultural studies including analysis of consumer society, identity, space, and memory.

Name: CULT 205 Introduction to Contemporary Japan Through Pop Culture
Description: Contemporary Japanese society through topics in popular culture, such as gender performativity, forms of play, manga, anime and film. In English. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 205 or JPST 215.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of first-year ENGL.)

Name: CULT 210 Reading Screens
Description: Introduction to film and other screen-based media as narrative, with a focus on both formal and ideological elements. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 210 or ENGL 215.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of first-year CULT and 3 credits of first-year ENGL.)

Name: CULT 215 Cultural Industries
Description: An introductory critical study of cultural industries such as television and popular music.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=2
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Second-year standing.)

Name: CULT 220 Research with Media in the Humanities
Description: Working in the context of fine arts and humanities research, students develop methods for multimedia research. No digital humanities or computing experience required. At least 35% of class time involves instruction in humanities criticism, prototyping, writing, and research. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT220 and DIHU 220.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of 100-level CULT, DIHU, ENGL, or FILM 100)

Name: CULT 230 Foundations: Reading Across Borders
Description: Critical intercultural reading approaches, focusing on literature and film from the global South. Emphasis upon ideas of culture, difference, and the relations between reader and text. At least 35% of class time involves practice-based instruction in critical analysis, essay writing and research. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 230 or ENGL 224.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of first-year CULT and 3 credits of first-year ENGL.)

Name: CULT 250 Foundations: Indigenous Literature
Description: Survey of Indigenous-authored poetry, drama, fiction, non-fiction prose, and orature in North America, with attention to Indigenous methodologies and major critical trends. At least 35% of class time involves practice-based instruction in critical analysis, essay writing and research. Credit will be granted for only one of ENGL 234 or CULT 250.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of first-year CULT and 3 credits of first-year ENGL.)

Name: CULT 272 Feminism and Environment
Description: Examines contributions of feminist theories and practice to understanding and addressing environmental change. Foregrounds the role of decolonial, anti-racist, disability justice and queer feminist perspectives in environmental justice, policy, art, and activism. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 272 or GWST 272.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of first-year CULT or SUST 104.)

Name: CULT 275 Foundations: Interdisciplinary Theory and Method in Literary Research
Description: Study of the major trends in critical theory. Attention will be given to applications of theory in literary research. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 275 or ENGL 250.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of first-year CULT and 3 credits of first-year ENGL.)

Name: CULT 303 Narrative Film Production
Description: The theory and practice of producing a short narrative motion picture for the purpose of developing narrative film literacy. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 303, CULT 316, FILM 303, or THTR 303. VISA 106, VISA 261, VISA 271, CULT 210, THTR 103, CRWR 250, or FILM 100 recommended.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of VISA 106, VISA 261, FILM 261. (and third-year standing or permission of the instructor.)

Name: CULT 305 English-Canadian Screen Culture
Description: Development of English-Canadian screen culture studied by concentrating on various movements, the political economy of Anglo-Canadian screen culture, and televisual and cinematic forms and genres. Focus of the survey is on identity, nationhood, and representation. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 305 or ENGL 377.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing. CULT 210, CULT 215, or CULT 220 recommended.)

Name: CULT 309 Performance Art: Global Perspectives
Description: History, theory, and practice of performance art as a visual medium, a global language, and a political force. Explores a wide range of experimental and interdisciplinary performance art practices, including key contributions by Indigenous artists. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 309, THTR 309, ARTH 309 or CULT 380.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: CULT 312A Internet Culture - INTERNET CULT
Description: A critical study of the cultural influence of the Internet on everyday life. With different topics, this course may be taken more than once for credit. No more than 9 credits in total will be granted for CULT 312, DIHU 312, or any combination thereof. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 312 and DIHU 312 when the subject matter is of the same nature.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: CULT 315 Television Studies
Description: The medium of television from a global perspective, and the investigation of how genres in different television broadcast regimes shape content and reception. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 315 or ENGL 376.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing. CULT 201, CULT 215, or CULT 220 recommended.)

Name: CULT 317 Digital Documentary Production
Description: Theory and practice from the point of view of producer/writer/director. Course culminates in the creation of a short-form documentary. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 317 or FILM 371.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of VISA 106, VISA 261, FILM 261. (and third-year standing or permission of the instructor.)

Name: CULT 340 Colonialism and Decolonization
Description: Comparative analysis of the cultural project of European colonialism, including colonial discourse, resistance, and decolonization in Africa, the Caribbean, South and Southeast Asia, and North America. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 340 or ENGL 379. CULT 230, CULT 250, or CULT 275 recommended.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of CULT and third-year standing. CULT 230 or 250 recommended.)

Name: CULT 346 Human Rights, Literature, and Culture
Description: Critical analysis of representational practices within humanitarian and human rights discourses, including literature, life writing, film, journalism, and marketing. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 346 or ENGL 384. CULT 230, CULT 250, or CULT 275 recommended.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of CULT and third-year standing.)

Name: CULT 351 Settler Studies, Literature, and Culture
Description: Approaches to the interdisciplinary field of settler colonial studies in Canadian and comparative contexts in relation to literature, film, and other forms of cultural production. Examines the role of representation, narrative, and discourse in settlement, colonization, and decolonization. Credit will be granted for only one of ENGL 385 or CULT 351.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of 200-level CULT. CULT 250 or ENGL 234 is recommended.)

Name: CULT 362A Advanced Practice in Photography - ADV PRAC PHOTO
Description: Advanced studio course in digital- and film-based photography. Emphasis on photography as an artistic tool. This course may be taken twice for a maximum of 6 credits. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CULT 362, CULT 310, VISA 362, or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (VISA 244 and 256 or permission of the instructor. Note: for VISA 244, CULT students require permission of instructor.)

Name: CULT 362B Advanced Practice in Photography - ADV PRAC PHOTO
Description: Advanced studio course in digital- and film-based photography. Emphasis on photography as an artistic tool. This course may be taken twice for a maximum of 6 credits. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CULT 362, CULT 310, VISA 362, or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (VISA 244 and 256 or permission of the instructor. Note: for VISA 244, CULT students require permission of instructor.)

Name: CULT 370 Writing the Self: Theory and Practice
Description: Life writing with a focus on gender. Critical analysis and the production of narrative in such genres as memoir, autotheory, autoethnography, and critical poetics. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 370 or GWST 340.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 Credits of 100 or 200-level CULT and third-year standing.)

Name: CULT 371A Modern Critical Theory and Interdisciplinary Methods - MDN CRIT THRY
Description: Advanced survey of major trends within critical theory, with attention to issues such as subjectivity and power, the body, culture and imperialism, and social discourse. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CULT 371, ENGL 309 or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of 200-level CULT or 200-level ENGL. One of CULT 270, CULT 275 recommended.)

Name: CULT 382A Advanced Practice in Media Arts - ADV MED ARTS
Description: Advanced interdisciplinary course addressing the importance of technology-based approaches in contemporary art, with emphasis placed upon the formation of an idea and the media most appropriate to its expression. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CULT 382, CULT 311, VISA 382, or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of VISA 206, VISA 266, VISA 268, VISA 269, VISA 271. (or permission of the instructor.)

Name: CULT 382B Advanced Practice in Media Arts - ADV MED ARTS
Description: Advanced interdisciplinary course addressing the importance of technology-based approaches in contemporary art, with emphasis placed upon the formation of an idea and the media most appropriate to its expression. No more than 6 credits in total will be granted for CULT 382, CULT 311, VISA 382, or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of VISA 206, VISA 266, VISA 268, VISA 269, VISA 271. (or permission of the instructor.)

Name: CULT 390A Identities and Power: Areas and Themes - ENVIRO JUSTICE
Description: Examination of selected themes related to identities and power. With different topics, this course can be taken more than once for credit. Topics vary from year to year.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: CULT 411 Performance Studies
Description: Seminar in the interdisciplinary field of performance studies, broadly conceived as the investigation of aesthetic, ritual, and everyday life performance practices. Credit will be granted for only one of CULT 411, CULT 480 or THTR 411.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in year: >=3
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: CULT 450 Studies in Indigenous Literature and Criticism
Description: Topics in Indigenous literature and criticism in North America, including particular periods and individual authors. Credit will be granted for only one of ENGL 473 or CULT 450.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of 200-level CULT. CULT 250 recommended.)

Name: CULT 470A Interdisciplinary Studies in Critical Theory - CONST HYSTERIA
Description: Advanced study of a particular area within critical theory. Topics may include queer theory, critical animal studies, ethics, post-humanism, and nationalism. No more than 9 credits in total will be granted for CULT 470, ENGL 412 or any combination thereof.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of 200-level CULT. One of CULT 270, CULT 275 recommended.)

Name: CULT 490B Topics in Identities and Power - BLACK INTEL TRAD
Description: Advanced study of an area of identities and power. With different topics this course may be taken more than once for credit.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of 200-level CULT)

Name: CULT 490F Topics in Identities and Power - QUEER THEATRE
Description: Advanced study of an area of identities and power. With different topics this course may be taken more than once for credit.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (3 credits of 200-level CULT)

Name: CULT 495A Directed Studies - DIR STUDIES
Description: Major research paper required.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: BA-O in year: >=3 with one of these specializations: MAJ CULT
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing and declared CULT major.)

Name: CULT 495B Directed Studies - DIR STUDIES
Description: Major research paper required.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: BA-O in year: >=3 with one of these specializations: MAJ CULT
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing and declared CULT major.)

Name: CUST 562 Curriculum Issues and Theories
Description: Curriculum theories and issues are explored through a review of literature (historical and contemporary) and critical reflection on existing practices. Provides a basis for examining knowledge claims, beliefs and assumptions underpinning contemporary understandings and practices of curriculum.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MA-O,MED-O

Name: DATA 101 Making Predictions with Data
Description: Introduction to the techniques and software for handling real-world data. Topics include data cleaning, visualization, simulation, basic modelling, and prediction making.

Name: DATA 301 Introduction to Data Analytics
Description: Techniques for computation, analysis, and visualization of data using software. Manipulation of small and large data sets. Databases. Automation using scripting. Real-world applications from life sciences, physical sciences, economics, engineering, or psychology. No prior computing background is required. Cannot be used for credits toward a major in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or Statistics. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 301, DATA 301 or DATA 501.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing.)

Name: DATA 310 Applied Regression Analysis
Description: Theory and application of simple and multiple linear regression models, estimation, inference (confidence intervals, prediction intervals and hypothesis testing), polynomial regression, ANOVA and ANCOVA, variable selection, model adequacy and residual diagnostics.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of STAT 205, STAT 230, MATH 221.

Name: DATA 311 Machine Learning
Description: Regression, classification, resampling, model selection and validation, fundamental properties of matrices, dimension reduction, tree-based methods, unsupervised learning.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: Either (a) one of STAT 205, STAT 230 or (b) a score more than 75% in one of APSC 254, BIOL 202, PSYO 373; and one of COSC 111, APSC 177.

Name: DATA 315 Applied Time Series and Forecasting
Description: Trends, stationary and nonstationary time series models, forecasting, seasonal models.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of STAT 205, STAT 230.

Name: DATA 405 Stochastic Modelling and Simulation
Description: Pseudorandom number generation and testing. Simulation and modelling of univariate and multivariate data; stochastic models, including Poisson processes and Markov chains; MCMC simulation, hidden Markov models, and queuing systems. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 405, DATA 405, COSC 505, or DATA 505.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of STAT 205, STAT 230 [with 60% or above].

Name: DATA 407 Sampling and Design
Description: Planning/practice of data collection. Pros/cons of both observational and experimental data. Survey samples: random sampling; bias and variance; unequal probability sampling; systematic, multistage, and stratified sampling; ratio and regression estimators. Experimental design: simple one-way comparisons; designs with randomization restrictions including blocking, split-plots, nested and repeated measures designs. Credit will be granted for only one of DATA 407 or STAT 507.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: One of STAT 205, STAT 230, PSYO 372, BIOL 202.

Name: DATA 410 Regression and Generalized Linear Models
Description: Regression, linear models, generalized linear models, additive models, generalized additive models, mixed models, theory and numerical performance. Credit will be granted for only one of DATA 410 or STAT 538.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 310.

Name: DATA 419C Topics in Data Science - STAT LEARNING
Description: Advanced or specialized topics in data science. Consult the department for the specific topic to be offered in any given year. This course may be taken more than once for credit with different topics.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Fourth-year standing.)

Name: DATA 448A Directed Studies in Data Science - DIR ST DATA SCIE
Description: Investigation of a specific topic as agreed upon by the student and the faculty supervisor. Completion of a project and an oral presentation are required.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing in the Data Science major or Honours, and permission of the department head.)

Name: DATA 448B Directed Studies in Data Science - DIR ST DATA SCIE
Description: Investigation of a specific topic as agreed upon by the student and the faculty supervisor. Completion of a project and an oral presentation are required.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing in the Data Science major or Honours, and permission of the department head.)

Name: DATA 448C Directed Studies in Data Science - DIR ST DATA SCIE
Description: Investigation of a specific topic as agreed upon by the student and the faculty supervisor. Completion of a project and an oral presentation are required.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Third-year standing in the Data Science major or Honours, and permission of the department head.)

Name: DATA 449 Honours Thesis
Description: Students will undertake a research project as agreed upon by the student, supervising faculty member, and unit head. A written thesis and a public presentation (poster or seminar) are required. Restricted to students in the B.Sc. Data Science Honours Program.
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: (Fourth-year standing and permission of the department head.)

Name: DATA 500 Communication and Consulting in Data Science
Description: Effective consulting practices, ethical considerations, methodology selection, data preparation, effective software development. Credit will be granted for only one of DATA 500 or STAT 400 when the subject matter is of the same nature.

Name: DATA 505 Modelling and Simulation
Description: Simulation methodology: data collection, model design, output analysis, optimization, validation. Credit will be granted for only one of COSC 405, DATA 405, COSC 505, or DATA 505.

Name: DATA 530 Computing Platforms for Data Science
Description: Introduction to software and tools for Data Science. Setup process. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 531 Programming for Data Science
Description: Programming including decisions, loops, functions, and using data structures and libraries. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 532 Algorithms and Data Structure
Description: Data structures including lists, queues, stacks, hash tables, trees and graphs. Recursion. Searching and sorting. Asymptotic complexity. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 533 Collaborative Software Development
Description: Software life cycle. Licensing. Packaging. Testing and quality control. Version control. Collaborative environments. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 532.

Name: DATA 534 Web and Cloud Computing
Description: Parallel and cloud computing architectures and program deployment. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 540 Databases and Data Retrieval
Description: Using and querying relational and NoSQL databases for analysis. Experience with SQL, JSON, and programs that use databases. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 531.

Name: DATA 541 Scripting and Reporting
Description: Scripting engines for data science. Reporting tools. Automation. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 542 Data Wrangling
Description: Manipulation of data using software tools. Data conversion, filtering, sorting, grouping, cleaning, parsing. Automation. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of DATA 532, DATA 540, DATA 541.

Name: DATA 543 Data Collection
Description: Fundamental techniques in the collection of data. Focus will be devoted to understanding the effects of randomization, restrictions on randomization, repeated measures and blocking on the model fitting. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of DATA 540, DATA 570.

Name: DATA 550 Dataviz I
Description: Data visualization to produce graphs and images. Advanced data analysis on spreadsheets. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of DATA 530, DATA 531.

Name: DATA 551 Dataviz II
Description: Data visualization using business intelligence and data analysis software. Interactive visualization. Production of visualizations for mobile and web. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of DATA 534, DATA 543, DATA 550.

Name: DATA 552 Communication and Argumentation
Description: Interpretation of data. Argumentation: hypothesis, claim, evidence and inference. Model limitations: bias, validity, reliability, sensitive analysis. Communication of recommendations to decision-makers. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 553 Privacy, Security and Professional Ethics
Description: Data privacy laws and expectations. Freedom of information. Ethics board. Licensing. Data security. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 570 Predictive Modelling
Description: Introduction to regression for Data Science. Simple linear regression, multiple linear regression, interactions, mixed variable types, model assessment, simple variable selection, k-nearest-neighbours regression. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 580.

Name: DATA 571 Resampling and Regularization
Description: Resampling techniques and regularization for linear models. Bootstrap, jackknife, cross-validation, ridge regression, lasso, discussion of tuning parameters. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 570.

Name: DATA 572 Supervised Learning
Description: Analysis of data with categorical responses. Logistic regression, k-nearest-neighbours classification, discriminant analysis, decision trees and random forests. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 571.

Name: DATA 573 Unsupervised and Semi-supervised Learning
Description: Analyses for data with unknown responses. Distance measures, hierarchical clustering, k-means, mixture models. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 572.

Name: DATA 580 Modelling and Simulation I
Description: Pseudorandom number generation, testing and transformation to other discrete and continuous data types. Introduction to Poisson processes and the simulation of data from predictive models, as well as temporal and spatial models. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O

Name: DATA 581 Modelling and Simulation II
Description: Markov chains and their applications, for example, queueing and Markov Chain Monte Carlo. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 580.

Name: DATA 582 Bayesian Inference
Description: Introduction to Bayesian paradigm and tools for Data Science. Topics include Bayes theorem, prior, likelihood and posterior. A detailed analysis of the cases of binomial, normal samples, normal linear regression models. A significant focus will be on computational aspects of Bayesian problems using software packages. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of DATA 572, DATA 581.

Name: DATA 583 Advanced Predictive Modelling
Description: Splines. Smoothing. Generalized linear models. Generalized additive models. An introduction to mixed models. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: All of DATA 572, DATA 581.

Name: DATA 585 Optimization
Description: Modelling using mathematical programming. Fundamental continuous and discrete optimization algorithms. Optimization software for small to medium scale problems. Optimization algorithms for data science. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 580.

Name: DATA 586 Advanced Machine Learning
Description: Neural networks, backpropagation, deep learning. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 580.

Name: DATA 589 Special Topic
Description: Advanced or specialized topic in Data Science with applications to specific data sets. Restricted to students in the MDS program.
Restrictions: This course is restricted to students in one of these programs: MDS-O
Pre-req string: Pre-reqs: DATA 543.

Name: DIHU 155 Writing and Making with Technology in the Humanities
